Reviews.Title: “Super friendly”
Reviews.Author: mothballjp
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed on a weekend of March for 2 nights. Guys works there are super friendly and that's pretty important, isn't it? Room we stayed was right front of the reception. Clean and comfortable but one minus point is a noise from corridor. Probably the result of the thin door but the hotel itself is an old house and could be worse. Street noise is another thing, but considering the location, well, ear plug might do good night sleep. Breakfast was a nice surprise. Definitely worth a money. Would we stay there again? Probably yes. To be greeted by nice and friendly nice looking guys are tempting enough, or?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: electyone
Reviews.Content: By rating ArtHotel Connection as 'excellent' because it delivers for its price, and, I would even say, over-delivers. It's not a 5-star hotel. It's a small privately owned hotel in the gay neighbourhood of Berlin, but for the price you pay you get incredibly a lot. The guys at the hotel are super-friendly, the hotel is very clean, the design is great, and there were some really nice touches, like touch lamps, reading lamps, nice and new showers. I felt welcome. I've read complains about WiFi in some other reviews, but during my 6 day stay WiFi was working perfectly in my room. I was staying in a single room with a shared toilet, so the room was very small but conveniently laid out. I've seen the larger - double and family rooms - passing by, and those looked spacious. I will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Would not hesitate to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Enjoys_Relaxing
Reviews.Content: 2-3 blocks away from KaDeWe is this converted apartment unit in a periodic building that boasts a great front office staff, large beds, high ceilings, and convenience to everything one would need on a vacation. Although the hotel doesn't have a restaurant, it does have a breakfast room. The only downside is internect connection can be tricky and noise travels from the central hallway where rooms are lined on either side. Get a suite as it is extremely comfortable, and you cannot beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place for a Berlin stay”
Reviews.Author: hikeusaf
Reviews.Content: Everything about the stay was superb! Correspondence in advance of the trip was prompt, courteous and helpful. Arrival and check-in was easy, and the staff was incredibly gracious and accommodating throughout our stay - providing tremendous insight into the local area and Berlin too. The room was perfect, well appointed and an excellent value for the money. Although especially ideal for gay travelers, the location was so convenient (especially for public transportation), the staff so friendly and the rate so reasonable, I would suggest a stay at this hotel to any traveler. I can't imagine staying anyplace else in Berlin and will definitely recommend this place to all my friends. I look forward to my next trip to Berlin and especially my next stay at ArtHotel Connection.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful manager”
Reviews.Author: SweetBoyIndy
Reviews.Content: Chuck really helped us find our way around Berlin and was very helpful with directions and maps and suggestions. (Thank you Chuck!!) We had a great view, an updated bathroom and a stylishly decorated and comfortable room. Also, the hotel is close to the KaDaWe department store and other shopping areas in addition to being a few blocks away from the subway. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “ArtHotel, perfect for a Berlin city break”
Reviews.Author: jasmaswes
Reviews.Content: Berlin is one of my favourite cities to visit and now I have a hotel in this great city I will recommend and come back to. The location is perfectly central for exploring the city with great shops, bars and restaraunts in walking distance. The hotel was comfortably furnished and stylish, and you cannot fault the helpful and caring staff

Reviews.Title: “beautiful friendly wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dontcomeback
Reviews.Content: New management took over in 2009. They are fantastically friendly and helpful. The newly refurbished rooms are great. The hotel is in a wonderful old apartment with high ceilings, and beautiful features like the original cornicing and parquet flooring. Breakfasts were lovely too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Alexander M
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious, friendly staff, perfect location right smack in the middle of the gay district. But also nice if you are not gay I suppose. :-) We had a "play and stay" appartment wich was great. Staff where alsways helpful and friendly, we didnt try the breakfast evn though you can untill 16:00 or 17:00 hours every day (great!) Was staying with a friend and liked it so much I allready booked again for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings about this one”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: There is much to recommend about this hotel but I had a very awkward conversation with one of the front desk people that really put me off, so I'll go though it in my review. On the positive side, the location is wonderful, great neighborhood for cafes and shopping. Easy to get to public transport. The hotel is in an old building with all kinds of charm and the rooms are renovated, modern and comfortable. I booked a double room for extra space and was not disappointed in the space. The breakfast for 7 Euros every morning is pretty decent and is a good way to get the meal done without alot of fuss. On the downside they seemed to always be short of towels and for a couple of nights I was denied a request for an extra towel because they had simply run out of clean towels. After a day of site-seeing I returned to my room and could not find some US Dollars that I left on my desk. I look everywhere and finally I decided that I would have to tell the front desk. I wasn't really looking to accuse their staff, but I thought that if other guests had reported missing items or cash, this might be a pattern they would need to know about. When I told the front desk person, their only comment was that the "wind probably blew it away" because the window may have been open. I was heart broken. I really wanted to like this place, but because of this very weak response I realized that they really did not care about my stay. Even if they think I'm making this up, what trouble would it be to actually act like they're concerned? Apparantly too much trouble. Ultimately I cannot accuse anyone of stealing the money, it was not a lot of money and I have no proof that anyone took it, but I'm so disheartened by the response to my situation that I cannot recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great B&B right in the gay area, not a hotel though”
Reviews.Author: panagiotis123
Reviews.Content: All in all our experience from ArtHotel was quite good. Friendly staff, very clean room and spacious. We had breakfast there both days and it was of a good quality and quantity. Location wise, its right in the centre of the gay area, full of bars/clubs (one right on the ground floor of the B&B - Connection). Really cool bar close is called "Blonde". There are good restaurants around as well. One in particular called "More". The Metro is 2 minutes walk away and its only 2 stops to the centre and "the Wall" remains and shopping district. I was pleased with the hotel but one thing i should say that is missing is a common lounge or bar area where you can unwind (instead of going straight to your room) and maybe meet other guests and thats why i don't call this a hotel but only a B&B.

Reviews.Title: “OK - more B&B than hotel”
Reviews.Author: PBar_11
Reviews.Content: Good location, but the idea that this is a hotel rather than a B&B is a bit of a push...

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Schoneberg.... not all rooms renovated.”
Reviews.Author: bolgerp
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the recommendation from a friend and having read the reviews on Trip Advisor. Six of us were in Berlin arriving at various stages from Sat Feb 26th to Tue March 1st. Both of us that arrived on Feb 28th were put in rooms 4 and 8 respectively. These rooms were lovely. Obviously recently decorated and very well appointed. My friends (two girls... a couple) arrived on Monday the 28th Feb and were placed in a room in what seemed like a different part of the hotel. It was not recently renovated and was previously, or so they thought, a play room. It didn't even have a room number!! Perhaps this was because the hotel was full? Who knows. Then the last two arrived on Tuesday morning. They were put in a room that was VERY orange!! Obviously was in the process of being renovated as it wasn't quite finished. There was still some painting that needed to be completed around the windows. This is not a "hotel" in the traditional sense of the word. For example, there is not a 24 hour reception or bar etc. etc. However, the location is great for exploring all around Schoneberg and it's a 3 minute walk to the U Bhan in Wittenberg Plaz and you can also pick up all the Sightseeing buses from outside KaDeWe there too. There are some goods little restaurants around also. Personally, I think it was good value for money but I doubt my friends would agree considering the rooms that they had.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best experiences ever”
Reviews.Author: Ferrelled
Reviews.Content: First, to let you know this is a genuine review, you can cross-reference my review on the hotel's own site. That said, this was one of the best hotel experiences I've had. The bed was high and firm, the sheets silky. Large windows which were easily opened. Each room had it's own unique, bespoke welded stainless-steel bed. The large, square European pillows were great for snuggling/cuddling. The staff, Hauke and Chuck especially, couldn't have been more welcoming or more helpful. The pictures on the hotel's own website are accurate. Go for rooms 6 and 8 if you want the higher-end rooms. Room 2 if you're playful (ask the hotel about 2 and 13). At first, I was concerned about booking as I've never read a series of reviews so glowing. Barely a negative and those seemed minor. But I was more than pleasantly surprised - as was my mate who had a larger room. The location is ideal: 20 minutes or so from Tegel; right next to one of the best bars in Berlin (Prinzknecht) and, otherwise, in between a plethora of bars and the Wittenberg Church - and shopping. Close to U2, U-Bahn line as well. Definitely the first place I would consider for a return trip to Berlin. Recommended without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice.”
Reviews.Author: clevelandrub
Reviews.Content: Flying stand-by is usually tricky, so I knew there was a chance that we'd be late and let Jens know. The instructions Jens gave us on how to get to the place and how to enter the building in case we arrived late were spot-on. We met our host Hauke at breakfast. He was fun to talk with. He tips on what to do in the city were quite helpful. It's in a nice, historic gay neighborhood, and we felt safe in the nieghborhood. There's a really nice gay bar next to the hotel named Prinzknecht. The clientele is mature men. We'd like to spend more time there next time in Berlin. The hotel is really close to KaDeWe Dept Store, another place we liked. The KaDeWe Food Hall on the 6th floor and is amazing. Lots of stations including champagne bars. The hotel is very close to the underground Metro, so it's easy to get around the city. Bring euro coins for buying metro tickets. Although the machines show that they take cash and cards, the machines aren't reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Wunderbar !”
Reviews.Author: Rudingtons
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel. Superb location with friendly helpful staff. Rooms full of character and very clean. Close to fantastic nightlife and also great travel links. Seriously cannot recommend this place highly enough. Can't wait for return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Small and friendly and a little bit camp!”
Reviews.Author: LondonSolo_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September on a long weekend. The hotel is marketed at the gay community, however they make everyone feel welcome. It is on the third floor of an apartment building in a predominantly gay area. The room I stayed in was large and well furnished, with a lovely shower room that ran hot and strong. My room was well decorated in silver, blue and black and a very comfortable bed. There is free wireless throughout the hotel. When I arrived the man on reception let me check in even though it was before lunch time, and took the time to give me a map of the city and pointed out on the map interesting sights, good restaurants and public transport connections. Breakfast is served in an ever so slightly camp breakfast room with black tables and zebra skin chairs. Mostly a continental type breakfast, but delicious scrambled eggs as well. Walking back quite late felt quite safe, even though the streets are not that well lit, and despite the hotel being on a street with bars and clubs that were open quite late, the room was quiet as there were double windows. An excellent choice of hotel in Berlin if you want to avoid the larger impersonal chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very personal and knowledgable service with an air of European flair.”
Reviews.Author: Wjlewis
Reviews.Content: The best features of the ArtHotel Connection are the people running this establishment. The staff were knowledgable about current events happening in Berlin, about the tourist scene as well as the night life, and about great bargains around the city. This hotel is located with easy access to shopping, to the public transportation system, and to night life venues. During our stay, an unseasonable heat wave was hitting Europe, and the staff bent over backwards to ensure our comfort. We availed ourselves of the breakfast in the morning (available for a nominal fee) and were not disappointed with this European style fare. The coffee? Strong enough to jump start our day. All in all, an excellent stay for our five days!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and friendly staff....”
Reviews.Author: bchboy
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay of 5 nights here. Location was excellent, hotel was immaculate. Room was small but comfortable even without w.c. That was just down the hotel. This hotel is one floor (elevator) in an apartment / office building two blocks from buses and subway. Relaxing and low key if you don't need a lot of services. Comfortable for gay & non gay guests.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Berlin's Gay District Schoeneberg”
Reviews.Author: LeonJE32
Reviews.Content: Perfectly Located Gay Hotel in Schoeneberg, very pleasant neighborhood, with many clubs, restaurants, cafes and bars in the vicinity. Extremely close to all forms of public transport, which allows for very easy visiting of main attractions and daytrips. It is also really close to West Berlin’s shopping district (KaDeWe, Ku’damm etc.). Room was very big for a city hotel, with comfortable bed (hard mattress – which we liked a lot). The safe box in the room made everything very convenient. Room was cleaned on a daily basis. Staff was very helpful and kind, but in the evenings the reception was closed. The hotel was recently refurbished, so everything felt new and clean. Smoking is allowed in the rooms, and since we do not smoke that was not an up-side. However, the smoky smell (which could be felt upon entering the room) was very very subtle and did not bother us at all (despite our usual sensitivity to such things). Despite the hotel’s central location the sound insulation was great, we slept like babies. The room was also very well air conditioned to a comfortable temperature. Check in and check out were a breeze, and the taxi and limo service from the airport saved us a lot of time and earned us another day of site-seeing. Overall, it is an excellent place to stay while visiting Berlin, very good value for one’s money (whether you’re gay or not :) ).

HotelInfo.Name: ArtHotel Connection
HotelInfo.Address: Fuggerst. 33, 10777 Berlin, Germany
